Articles.Content:
What are some good mods for adding extra planets without disturbing the original orbits much? I want something "Kerbalesque" so none of the "Real Solar System" stuff.

I really like the Kerbol Plus mod's intentions and design ideas but I am a little disheartened after spending hours designing ships to land on the new bodies and finding out the mod is glitchy and landing was impossible due to terrain height issues.

New Horizons sounds awesome but I am really not in love with the idea of changing the stock system orbits.

Are there any others out there?

The "Outer Planets Mod" seems to be well-spoken-of, though I recently found that you need to install another mod (Kopernicus) first, which I haven't done yet. (But since I've only successfully landed on the Mun and Minmus so far, I'm not in any immediate danger of running out of planets yet...)

Trans-Keptuinan adds a Kuiper-like belt even outside the Outer Planets.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/109125-1-0-x-Trans-Keptunian-Outer-dwarf-planet-pack-%28v0-4-06-07-15%29](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/109125-1-0-x-Trans-Keptunian-Outer-dwarf-planet-pack-%28v0-4-06-07-15%29)

Boris and Chani planet packs do not change the stock planets.

Some of their planets are closer to the Sun than Moho, or placed between Kerbin and Duna.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/70018-1-0-x-Kopernicus-The-Boris-System-%28new-planets%29-Updated-7-19-2015-creating-planets-on-Twitch](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/70018-1-0-x-Kopernicus-The-Boris-System-%28new-planets%29-Updated-7-19-2015-creating-planets-on-Twitch)

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129073-1-0-4-Chani-Planet-Pack-%28Kopernicus-Pack%29-%28Version-1-0-1%29-Lots-of-pictures-added](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129073-1-0-4-Chani-Planet-Pack-%28Kopernicus-Pack%29-%28Version-1-0-1%29-Lots-of-pictures-added)!

> 
> The "Outer Planets Mod" seems to be well-spoken-of, though I recently found that you need to install another mod (Kopernicus) first, which I haven't done yet. (But since I've only successfully landed on the Mun and Minmus so far, I'm not in any immediate danger of running out of planets yet...)

That changes Eeloo though.
